sections.name: Hook - Peaked T-Waves
sections.text: This patient's EKG looks like Mount Everest - peaked T-waves screaming hyperkalemia, and you've got about 60 seconds before this heart goes into V-fib.

sections.name: The Crisis - Potassium Level
sections.text: Potassium comes back at 7.2 - the kidney said 'I quit' and now the heart's about to follow. This is a CODE situation people.
sections.notes: Critical lab value, organ personification, doom

sections.name: Danger - Heart Stopping
sections.text: The heart is doing the electrical equivalent of a washing machine on spin cycle - ventricular fibrillation is knocking on the door.
sections.notes: Washing machine metaphor, chaos, impending doom

sections.name: Question - What's Your Move
sections.text: TICK TOCK future doctors - what's your move? The patient's looking at you like you're supposed to know what to do.
sections.notes: Direct challenge to viewer, pressure, quiz moment

sections.name: Answer - Calcium Gluconate
sections.text: It's CALCIUM GLUCONATE baby! Slam that IV push - stabilize the cardiac membrane before everything goes sideways.

sections.name: Wrong Answer Roast
sections.text: Half of you reached for insulin first - that's cute but insulin just shifts the potassium, it doesn't protect the heart. You played yourself.

sections.name: Mechanism - How It Works
sections.text: Calcium acts like a bodyguard for the heart - it doesn't lower potassium, it just says 'not today' to the arrhythmia trying to kill your patient.

sections.name: Exit - Peace Out
sections.text: Now get outta here and save some lives. You're welcome.
